dialogues.speaker: robotoro
dialogues.text: Welcome back, Digipalz! As we know from our last mission, a menacing bully has been targeting students at Red Valley Elementary School and has made some serious violations to the school's anti-bullying policies.

dialogues.speaker: luna
dialogues.text: We're far from done, Robotoro. We still don't know who the bully is.

dialogues.speaker: robotoro
dialogues.text: That's right, Luna. Which is why I am sending you and Milo on Mission #2: IP Addresses and Digital Footprints. By the end of this, you should be able to identify who the bully is.

dialogues.speaker: milo
dialogues.text: Cool. What are our Mission Tasks?

dialogues.speaker: robotoro
dialogues.text: I thought you'd never ask, but first, let's start with our news article. Remember, these articles are to help you understand why the mission is important.

content.title:
What You Do Online Stays Online:
 A Visit from Trooper Andrew
content.content:
Students at Harbor Beach schools in Michigan recently got a visit from someone who knows a lot about staying safe online — Trooper Andrew from the Michigan State Police. He spoke to students at the school in late January about something called a digital footprint. A digital footprint is the trail of things you leave behind when you use the internet — like messages, photos, videos, or posts. Even if you delete something, it can sometimes still be found later.

Trooper Andrew reminded everyone that many kids start using the internet at a young age. That means your digital footprint begins early. Every time you post something, comment on a video, or send a picture, it becomes part of your online history. He also explained that when people grow up and start applying for jobs or to colleges, companies might search their names online. What people find about you online could greatly affect your future - whether it’s getting the job you want, being accepted into college, pursuing medical or law school, or even earning a sports scholarship. The best way to stay safe is simple: think before you post. Ask yourself, “Is this something I would be proud to share?”

Some students were surprised to learn that even apps like Snapchat — where things are supposed to disappear — don’t really erase everything. Trooper Andrew shared that data can be saved or retrieved, even if it seems like it’s gone. But he didn’t come to scare anyone. His goal was to help students learn how to use the internet wisely. “The internet isn’t bad,” he said — it just takes smart choices to use it in a way that keeps you safe and helps you look good to others later on.

mission_brief.title: Mission Brief
mission_brief.description: Trooper Andrew was right. What you do online does leave a trail. It's called a digital footprint and it can last a lifetime. Like he said, even deleted things can be found again, especially by people who know how to do it. Some day, in the future, adults might look you up online. What they find could very well affect your future - whether you get that job you want, or get into the college you want to go to, or into Med School, Law school, or even get a sports scholarship. What is the best way for you to stay safe? Think before you post. Ask yourself, is this something I would be proud to share?

mission_brief.title: Mission Brief
mission_brief.description: Your mission awaits you. We still haven’t caught the bully behind Red Valley Elementary School’s chatroom. Time is ticking, Digipal. Your mission is to work with Luna and Milo to get to the bottom of it.

mission_tasks.title: Mission Tasks
mission_tasks.important_info: Your mission tasks.  Read them carefully.   This is what you will be quizzed on.

tasks.title: Task 1
tasks.description: Define IP addresses and devices that have an IP address.

tasks.title: Task 2
tasks.description: Explain what a digital footprint is and how they are made.

tasks.title: Task 3
tasks.description: Explain the difference between an active and passive footprint.

tasks.title: Task 4
tasks.description: Explain what a ‘cookie’ is and how they are used.

tasks.title: Task 5
tasks.description: Understand why your digital footprint can impact your future.

dialogues.speaker: robotoro
dialogues.text: We are still working on tracking down the bully who is targeting Katie and a few others. I've been tracing their footprints this morning. Mr. Pasternack, the tech teacher, will meet you in the media room at Red Valley Elementary School later this morning.

dialogues.speaker: milo
dialogues.text: OK, great. But can you please explain to me about my footprints, Robotoro?

dialogues.speaker: luna
dialogues.text: Not your stinky footprints, Milo! They're Digital Footprints.

dialogues.speaker: robotoro
dialogues.text: I’d be happy to explain what Digital Footprints are. What you do online is not private. Everywhere you go, you leave a trail of where you’ve been. This is called a digital footprint. Your digital footprint is used to track you in many different ways. It’s a trail of data that is formed with any online activity.

dialogues.speaker: robotoro
dialogues.text: Here, I made a short video to help explain it.

dialogues.speaker: luna
dialogues.text: Oh, I get it. Surfing the web is sort of like walking in sand. Each time you step, you leave a footprint of where you’ve been.

dialogues.speaker: robotoro
dialogues.text: Not only that, but there are 2 different kinds of digital footprints, active and passive. Active footprints are things that you intentionally do online, such as signing into your account, signing up for a newsletter, adding your name onto a list or posting a comment.

dialogues.speaker: robotoro
dialogues.text: Luna, I see you recently posted a book review on Victor the Vampire Bat. You just left an active digital footprint.

dialogues.speaker: robotoro
dialogues.text: And Milo, I see you posted a comment for a pizzeria you went to. You spelt cheese wrong, by the way. Anyhow, you also left an active digital footprint.

dialogues.speaker: luna
dialogues.text: I had no idea it could happen so easily. I’ve been leaving footprints all over the place. Now I know why I’m seeing so many ads for books about bats.

dialogues.speaker: robotoro
dialogues.text: Exactly. If you were an adult, your digital profile would be worth thousands of dollars to advertisers. Once they see you looking at something on a website, they send you ads for the same thing, hoping you eventually will buy it.

dialogues.speaker: luna
dialogues.text: I was also looking at stuffed plush toys for anxiety. I thought it would be nice to get a stuffed cuddly toy for Katie to help with her anxiety. Now I’m getting all sorts of ads for stuffed animals!

dialogues.speaker: milo
dialogues.text: Yeah, it’s happening to me too! I was looking at toy dinosaurs to add to my collection, now I'm getting ads for dinosaur puzzles.

dialogues.speaker: milo
dialogues.text: And dinosaur T-shirts.

dialogues.speaker: milo
dialogues.text: And everything with dinosaurs on it! I couldn’t figure out why.

dialogues.speaker: luna
dialogues.text: Well now we know why. Companies know what we are interested in, and now they are trying to get us to buy more things. I don’t even have a credit card.

dialogues.speaker: robotoro
dialogues.text: No, Luna, you don’t have a credit card. But your parents do! They do the same thing with your parents. When your mom looks at a purse online, the next day, other companies might start sending her ads for purses because they bought her digital data profile.

dialogues.speaker: milo
dialogues.text: Wow, that’s kind of sneaky isn’t it?

dialogues.speaker: robotoro
dialogues.text: Well, sort of. But they’re not forcing you to buy it, just tempting you and hoping it works. Just don’t click on anything! And now, Digipalz, you see why your digital data footprint is so valuable to companies.

dialogues.speaker: milo
dialogues.text: Robotoro, you said there were 2 kinds of Digital Footprints. What’s the other kind of footprint?

dialogues.speaker: robotoro
dialogues.text: It’s called a passive footprint. Your passive footprint is much more subtle, you are often not even aware that you are leaving these footprints. It happens when you are surfing the internet and you go on a site and it collects cookies. Sometimes it will even ask you to accept cookies. As a general rule, you should not accept cookies.

dialogues.speaker: milo
dialogues.text: I’ll accept cookies any time, especially chocolate chip cookies.

dialogues.speaker: luna
dialogues.text: No, Milo, you don’t eat the cookies! They plant them on your computer.

dialogues.speaker: robotoro
dialogues.text: I sure wish they had chocolate chips, I would eat those too.

dialogues.speaker: robotoro
dialogues.text: Milo and Luna, this is serious. When you accept cookies on a website, you're giving it permission to watch what you do online. That might not sound like a big deal — but over time, those websites can figure out your age, where you live, your hobbies, and even your email address… all without asking you directly. It’s like letting someone peek through your window every day to learn your habits — what you watch, what you search, even what games you play. Would you let a stranger do that in real life? No way. So don’t click "Accept" without thinking. Always ask: Do I really want to share this information?

dialogues.speaker: luna
dialogues.text: Wow, that’s really scary. They know so much about me without me telling them anything?

dialogues.speaker: robotoro
dialogues.text: Yes. It’s important that you know this. When you put something on the internet, it’s there forever. And I mean forever! You cannot erase your digital footprints.

dialogues.speaker: milo
dialogues.text: So it’s not like ocean waves flowing over your footprints in the sand and washing them away.

dialogues.speaker: luna
dialogues.text: No Milo, it’s more like walking on wet cement. It dries and your footprint is there forever.

dialogues.speaker: robotoro
dialogues.text: That’s correct Milo & Luna. Digital footprints are there forever. Before you head off to meet Mr. Pasternack, how about we play a game I made? Hopefully you remember from our last mission what you are supposed to do when you get a message from a bully!

dialogues.speaker: robotoro
dialogues.text: I’m glad to see most of you remembered to stop, screenshot, block and report. Well done Digipalz!

dialogues.speaker: robotoro
dialogues.text: Now get going you two, Mr. Pasternack is waiting.

dialogues.speaker: mr_pasternak
dialogues.text: Good afternoon, Digipalz! This kind woman here is from Chatroom Technologies. She's here to help us try to track down the cyberbully who’s sending mean and threatening messages to Katie.

dialogues.speaker: agent_phoebe
dialogues.text: Hi, I'm Agent Phoebe, I'm with the Incident Response Team. You said you have a possible bully situation? Thanks for raising the alarm.

dialogues.speaker: milo
dialogues.text: Hi, thank you for coming by on such short notice.

dialogues.speaker: agent_phoebe
dialogues.text: I am here to help. Mr. Pasternak filled me in on the details. It sounds serious. My role is to help identify the user who is guilty of making bullying comments online.

dialogues.speaker: luna
dialogues.text: Unfortunately, this user has been targeting the students and, recently, school staff. Earlier today, we uncovered multiple violations of our school policy. We need your help tracking this student down, but all we have is their username, Hockey_291. That's not much to go off of, is it?

dialogues.speaker: agent_phoebe
dialogues.text: It might seem like we've got almost nothing to work with, but the good news is, no one is really that ‘anonymous’ online. They just think they are.

dialogues.speaker: milo
dialogues.text: When people think they’re anonymous online, they believe they can get away with just about anything.

dialogues.speaker: agent_phoebe
dialogues.text: Exactly. Somebody might say something about you online that they are too afraid to say to your face. They think the premise of online anonymity is a free pass to target and threaten people!

dialogues.speaker: milo
dialogues.text: So, you're saying we can track this bully down, even if all we have is their username?

dialogues.speaker: agent_phoebe
dialogues.text: Well, in a sense. We have tools at our disposal to help us.

dialogues.speaker: luna
dialogues.text: What can you tell us about this user, 'Hockey_291'?

dialogues.speaker: agent_phoebe
dialogues.text: Let's see... our first line of defense is the IP address. Every IP address is unique. Just like your phone number or home address. All devices connected to the internet have an IP address, like a computer, a cell phone, a tablet and more! It can tell us a lot about a user’s location.

dialogues.speaker: milo
dialogues.text: How about a router, a smart TV, or a smart watch?

dialogues.speaker: agent_phoebe
dialogues.text: Yes, almost all electronics that connect to the internet. Even a smart microwave or an oven!

dialogues.speaker: luna
dialogues.text: And a baby monitor, a doorbell camera, and a smart speaker!

dialogues.speaker: milo
dialogues.text: And a toaster too?

dialogues.speaker: agent_phoebe
dialogues.text: No, Milo, a toaster is not connected to the internet, so it doesn’t need an IP address.

dialogues.speaker: agent_phoebe
dialogues.text: I’ve got a little game for you, Digipalz! Let’s see how many things you can identify that have IP addresses. Are you ready? Let’s go!

dialogues.speaker: agent_phoebe
dialogues.text: That was fun! Most of you got them right, congratulations. But here’s the thing…. Every year, more and more objects are getting IP addresses to connect to the internet. Did you know, for example, that they even have smart swim goggles?

dialogues.speaker: luna
dialogues.text: Why would swim goggles need to be connected to the internet?

dialogues.speaker: agent_phoebe
dialogues.text: So competitive swimmers can time themselves, track their distance and speed.

dialogues.speaker: milo
dialogues.text: Wow. I want one of those!

dialogues.speaker: agent_phoebe
dialogues.text: Here’s a short video that explains how IP addresses work.

dialogues.speaker: agent_phoebe
dialogues.text: So you see, with IP Addresses, you are not anonymous. And because of that, we can track down bullies and criminals.

dialogues.speaker: agent_phoebe
dialogues.text: From what I've been able to find, this is the IP address for 'Hockey_291'. We have to act quickly, before he’s on the move again.

dialogues.speaker: milo
dialogues.text: Woah! This is a great start, but we still don't have enough evidence, Luna! We need to call for backup. It’s time to involve the police.

dialogues.speaker: officer_emilio
dialogues.text: Sorry for keeping you waiting, Digipalz. I’ve been investigating the information that you sent me. You did the right thing by contacting me.

dialogues.speaker: luna
dialogues.text: No problem, Officer Emilio, we know how busy things are around here. Thanks for helping us. Was the IP address we gave you any help? We really need a break in this case!

dialogues.speaker: officer_emilio
dialogues.text: As you know, we take threats like this very seriously. From what you've explained to me, time is of the essence.

dialogues.speaker: luna
dialogues.text: Yes it is! Katie’s really shaken up, and we need to find out who the user is before they share the photo they’re threatening to post.

dialogues.speaker: officer_emilio
dialogues.text: We have authorization to look up the IP address's general location. It says the user is located in the Blue Mountain area. That's as narrow as we can provide, I'm afraid. I hope it's enough to help you.

dialogues.speaker: milo
dialogues.text: Thank you, Officer Emilio. It's the best lead we've had all day! We’ll take this information back to Principal Finley. Maybe she has an idea of how we can use it to track down our culprit!

dialogues.speaker: officer_emilio
dialogues.text: Wait Digipalz, before you run off, there’s something else I have to explain to you. Your bully may think that when they delete an email or their history or if they delete any photos, they are gone forever. Not so! We arrest many criminals this way!

dialogues.speaker: officer_emilio
dialogues.text: When we suspect someone is guilty of a crime, we may get a search warrant to take their devices, computers, tablet, and cell phones to our forensics computer lab. Our computer technicians can see everything, and I mean everything, that the suspect thinks they have erased. Because nothing is really erased. That’s how many criminals are caught. Good luck catching your culprit, Digipalz.

dialogues.speaker: principal_finley
dialogues.text: Good afternoon, Digipalz. Any news?

dialogues.speaker: luna
dialogues.text: Officer Emilio was very helpful. He was able to narrow down the IP address of our bullying student to somewhere in the Blue Mountain area. That's pretty far from here, why would a student live all the way out there?

dialogues.speaker: principal_finley
dialogues.text: Yes, Blue Mountain is a popular getaway for many families at our school. Whoever this student is, they must be spending spring break at Blue Mountain!

dialogues.speaker: luna
dialogues.text: That narrows our suspect list down, but now we have to find out which students are spending their spring break at Blue Mountain.

dialogues.speaker: principal_finley
dialogues.text: I know someone who might know... let me call them.

dialogues.speaker: principal_finley
dialogues.text: Now, there is no guarantee our culprit is Mr. Delavoy, and I don't want to treat him as guilty until we can confirm it.

dialogues.speaker: luna
dialogues.text: Yes, I believe it’s innocent until proven guilty.

dialogues.speaker: principal_finley
dialogues.text: That’s right, Luna. Sharing this student's name with you is sensitive, but as a school, we have a responsibility to uphold our Anti-Bullying Policy. Our Bullying Incident Response Protocol dictates that we must identify any student involved in serious breaches of our guidelines. If Declan is the one threatening to share sensitive photos of Katie... that warrants immediate action on our part.

dialogues.speaker: luna
dialogues.text: We need to protect students. And we need to especially support Katie, who has been very tormented by this.

dialogues.speaker: principal_finley
dialogues.text: Yes! Absolutely! Anyway Digipalz, you have a name, and I trust you will use discretion in your investigation. Find out if Declan is behind this. But be careful - make sure you have all the evidence you need before you make an accusation. We don’t want to blame an innocent student.

dialogues.speaker: luna
dialogues.text: Don’t worry, we won't let you down, Principal Finley. We’ll take this information back to headquarters and begin our analysis. Robotoro has been tracking their digital footprints.

dialogues.speaker: robotoro
dialogues.text: Hey guys, welcome back! Did you bring anything to eat? Do you know what robots eat for snacks?

dialogues.speaker: milo
dialogues.text: How would we know, Robotoro?

dialogues.speaker: robotoro
dialogues.text: Microchips! Get it? MicroChips? Ha Ha Ha!

dialogues.speaker: milo
dialogues.text: Hey, Robotoro, can we focus? We came back because we need your help with something.

dialogues.speaker: robotoro
dialogues.text: Fine. OK, I’ll change my mood. Reprogramming… programming… new sequence complete.

dialogues.speaker: luna
dialogues.text: We don’t have time to waste, the bully might change locations, then we have to start all over again, tracking the IP addresses. And what’s even more frightening is that they’re planning to send out the pictures of Katie tomorrow.

dialogues.speaker: luna
dialogues.text: Principal Finley has entrusted us with the name of a student we believe may be behind the cyberbullying happening at Red Valley Elementary. Can you find me the social media accounts for Declan Delavoy?

dialogues.speaker: robotoro
dialogues.text: Processing... processing. Done. All relevant social media profiles for a 'Declan Delavoy' found.

dialogues.speaker: milo
dialogues.text: Put them up on the screen!

dialogues.speaker: robotoro
dialogues.text: And what do we say?

dialogues.speaker: milo
dialogues.text: Could you please put them up on the screen?

dialogues.speaker: robotoro
dialogues.text: Ok, it’s on screen now.

dialogues.speaker: luna
dialogues.text: Hmmm… What account has been recently active?

dialogues.speaker: robotoro
dialogues.text: SnappyPals, he posted only 20 minutes ago.

dialogues.speaker: milo
dialogues.text: SnappyPals of course! Bring it up! Oh, sorry, I mean please bring it up, Robotoro.

dialogues.speaker: milo
dialogues.text: That looks like Blue Mountain to me. That confirms his location. Robotoro, can you please get Principal Finley on the line, we’ve got to let her know, ASAP.

dialogues.speaker: robotoro
dialogues.text: Ok. Processing now.

dialogues.speaker: robotoro
dialogues.text: OK, where are we going now?

dialogues.speaker: milo
dialogues.text: Robotoro, you have to wait right here until we get back.

dialogues.speaker: robotoro
dialogues.text: Okay, I see how it is, you visit, you get my help and then it's back out to save the world without me. Fine, I will sort the paper clips by colour until you return.

dialogues.speaker: luna
dialogues.text: Wait – Principal Finley is calling us.

dialogues.speaker: milo
dialogues.text: Let’s head out there now! Bye Robotoro! Behave yourself!

dialogues.speaker: luna
dialogues.text: Ummm, no, we’re not with Road Runner. Are you Declan?

dialogues.speaker: declan
dialogues.text: i might be. Who wants to know?

dialogues.speaker: luna
dialogues.text: My name is Luna and this is Milo. We’re here on behalf of Principal Finley. Your mom should be expecting us.

dialogues.speaker: declan
dialogues.text: Digipalz, huh. What kind of name is that? Martian?

dialogues.speaker: mrsDelavoy
dialogues.text: Declan, let them in, it’s freezing outside!

dialogues.speaker: declan
dialogues.text: Mom! It's weird when people just show up to other people's houses like this! Hey, did you guys eat my chicken nuggets?

dialogues.speaker: mrsDelavoy
dialogues.text: Declan, please go back to your room – you can wait for your precious chicken nuggets there. Digipalz, please, come in.

dialogues.speaker: milo
dialogues.text: Thank you, Mrs. Delavoy.

dialogues.speaker: mrsDelavoy
dialogues.text: My stomach has been in knots ever since Principal Finley called me. Declan's not a bad kid. I just can't see how he could be involved in this. Threatening to share pictures of a girl in her underwear? I raised him to be respectful, to treat others with dignity, to understand boundaries and to take responsibility for his actions. What he did is not just wrong, it’s harmful, it’s illegal, and it goes against everything I thought he understood.

dialogues.speaker: luna
dialogues.text: We don't have enough information to say definitively if he's involved. But, if we’re being honest with you, everything we’ve uncovered in our investigation, by following the IP addresses, has led us here.

dialogues.speaker: mrsDelavoy
dialogues.text: I see. And, what is that, exactly?

dialogues.speaker: milo
dialogues.text: Well, at the time these comments were posted, the perpetrator's IP address pointed us to this location. Declan is the only student we know of who is currently spending his spring break here at Blue Mountain.

dialogues.speaker: mrsDelavoy
dialogues.text: But, you don't know for sure, right? There could be other students here!

dialogues.speaker: luna
dialogues.text: The only way to know for sure would be to look at one of his devices, like his phone or his laptop, and we’ll see if the IP address matches.

dialogues.speaker: mrsDelavoy
dialogues.text: OK. But I’m hoping you have the wrong child!

dialogues.speaker: mrsDelavoy
dialogues.text: Declan! Please come back down here right now!

dialogues.speaker: declan
dialogues.text: Hey! Did the road runner bring my chicken nuggets yet? I’m starving!

dialogues.speaker: mrsDelavoy
dialogues.text: Declan, take out your cell phone please.

dialogues.speaker: declan
dialogues.text: What, why do you want my cell phone?

dialogues.speaker: milo
dialogues.text: Declan, we need to check if your phone matches the IP address of a user threatening to breach your school's online chatroom rules.

dialogues.speaker: declan
dialogues.text: What? It's not me. You're not getting my phone, it’s private. Mom, don't let them do this!

dialogues.speaker: mrsDelavoy
dialogues.text: This sounds serious, Declan. Just let them see your phone so they know it wasn't you!

dialogues.speaker: declan
dialogues.text: No! I didn't threaten to say anything bad, or threaten to post any photos!

dialogues.speaker: milo
dialogues.text: Declan, I didn't mention anything about photos...

dialogues.speaker: declan
dialogues.text: Wait... what? That's not fair!

dialogues.speaker: declan
dialogues.text: I mean, I saw someone post about photos... But, it wasn't me. I don't have photos of Katie! I swear!

dialogues.speaker: luna
dialogues.text: Who said anything about Katie?

dialogues.speaker: mrsDelavoy
dialogues.text: Declan, I would much rather hear the truth from you. Hand over your phone, I’m not going to ask again.

dialogues.speaker: declan
dialogues.text: Ok, here’s my cell. I think I hear the roadrunner coming. I’m going to go get my chicken nuggets now. See you later.

dialogues.speaker: mrsDelavoy
dialogues.text: Oh no! I don’t believe what I’m seeing. Declan, get back in here now! You do have inappropriate photos of a girl on your phone. Is this Katie? Declan, how could you do this?

dialogues.speaker: declan
dialogues.text: I was just trying to be funny.

dialogues.speaker: mrsDelavoy
dialogues.text: Declan, doing things like this online can have serious consequences. Did you know that the police had to get involved?

dialogues.speaker: declan
dialogues.text: I didn't mean for things to go this far.

dialogues.speaker: mrsDelavoy
dialogues.text: You need to apologize to Katie. And immediately delete those photos you have of Katie!

dialogues.speaker: declan
dialogues.text: Yes, I will. I'm embarrassed that I even had them to begin with. I promise I will get rid of everything.

dialogues.speaker: luna
dialogues.text: I think that’s a positive first step, Declan. Your actions really hurt Katie and her family.

dialogues.speaker: milo
dialogues.text: Not to mention your classmates, your teacher and your principal. You owe more than one apology.

dialogues.speaker: robotoro
dialogues.text: Well, it’s about time you got back. It has been exactly 6 hours, 24 minutes, and 54 seconds since you left.

dialogues.speaker: luna
dialogues.text: Hello Robotoro, did we miss anything important while we were away?

dialogues.speaker: robotoro
dialogues.text: Yes. I was very lonely here without you.

dialogues.speaker: milo
dialogues.text: Come on, Robo! We are working on a very important case right now for Principal Finley.

dialogues.speaker: robotoro
dialogues.text: I do not enjoy it when you are away from base for long periods of time.

dialogues.speaker: luna
dialogues.text: Yes we know, we’re sorry, Robotoro.

dialogues.speaker: robotoro
dialogues.text: Well, when you were away, I had time to make a new game for you. Here it is. You have to erase as many of the digital footprints as you can in one minute. You have to go quickly, some are bigger than others, some are faster than others. Ready, set GO!

dialogues.speaker: robotoro
dialogues.text: Ha ha, I tricked you! You guys were all trying so hard to erase them, but no matter how hard you try, you cannot erase digital footprints!

dialogues.speaker: robotoro
dialogues.text: Which brings me to my next point about Digital Footprints and how permanent they are. They will be there tomorrow, and the next day, and next week, and next month. They will be there next year, 5 years from now and 10 years from now. 20 years from now and even 40 years from now. Let’s take a minute and look into the future. I want you to think about something. What will you be doing in about 10 years from now?

dialogues.speaker: robotoro
dialogues.text: Please watch this video and think about what your digital footprints will tell the world about you.

dialogues.speaker: principal_finley
dialogues.text: Digipalz, I want to thank you for the work you did in solving this important mission. Katie went through so much distress over this and we need to support her in every way we can. We also need to thank her for being brave enough to talk to us about this. That took a lot of courage on her part.

dialogues.speaker: luna
dialogues.text: With enough proof, the police could have confiscated Declan's phone and laptop, and through digital forensics, the truth would have come out one way or another.

dialogues.speaker: principal_finley
dialogues.text: I'm glad it didn't come to that. Declan's apologized for his online comments, and to my relief, showed me proof that he'd deleted all copies of Katie’s photos.

dialogues.speaker: milo
dialogues.text: So, what's going to happen to him?

dialogues.speaker: principal_finley
dialogues.text: Needless to say, there will be disciplinary action because Declan violated our school policy. However, his honesty and apologies will factor into my decision. Good work, Digipalz.

dialogues.speaker: luna
dialogues.text: Anytime, Principal Finley. At least Declan now knows that what's done online doesn't always stay online, and online actions have real-world consequences.

dialogues.speaker: milo
dialogues.text: You're not as anonymous as you think.
